subject: College Athletics
Antitrust Laws and Competition Issues
Suits and Litigation (Civil)
lead_paragraph: A federal judge decided Friday in the so-called O’Bannon case, the most prominent lawsuit lodged against college sports’ governing body, that the N.C.A.A.'s current rules violate federal antitrust law.
snippet: A federal judge decided Friday in the so-called O’Bannon case, the most prominent lawsuit lodged against college sports’ governing body, that the N.C.A.A.'s current rules violate federal antitrust law.
